name: Tektronix BASIC
description: A version of BASIC for the Tektronix 4051 personal computer

commands.description: Returns arc cos of the specified cos ratio.  The result might be degrees, radians, or gradians depending on an environment variable for angle unit.
Returns arc sin of the specified sin ratio.  The result might be degrees, radians, or gradians depending on an environment variable for angle unit.
Returns arc tan of the specified tan ratio.  The result might be degrees, radians, or gradians depending on an environment variable for angle unit.
Calls a function or subroutine
Closes all files
Copies information from the graphics screen to a hard copy unit

Returns the cos of the specified angle.  Either cos or radCos may be better translations in WebLogo depending on the state of environment variables for the angle unit.  The angle may be in degrees, radians, or gradians.
Deletes the specified variables, lines of the program, or all variables and program
Rewinds or finds a file
Sets the comparison standard for non-zero numbers to specified numDigits and zero zomparison to zeroComparisonStandard.
Returns the system environmental parameters to a known state
Stores inputs in the specified variables
Kills a specified file on the internal magnetic tape or sends the killcommand to a specified device.
Creates a new file on specified device
Returns the number of free bytes remaining in memory
Moves to the specified absolute coordinates.  It looks like this is not affected by rotation and scale.
With no parameters, erasess the graphics screen and returns the cursor to the home position.  If a parameter is specified, it indicates the device to send the command to.
Executes a serial poll for devices 5, 10, and 15 on GPIB in that order.  Returns a 1 to the variable A if device 5 is requesting service...
Draws a line while moving to the specified offset.  The specified coordinates may be rotated using the rotate routine and scaled using scale.
Renumbers lines of code
Replaces part of a string with another
Moves by the specified offset.  rmove is similar to move except that rmove treats its parameters as relative.  rotate and scale commands will affect the interpretation of rmov parameters.
Rotates the specified angle.  The angle may be in degrees, radians, or gradients depending on an environment variable.
Sets the horizontal and vertical scale to the specified values.
Returns a segment of a specified string.  This is similar to WebLogo's substring command
Sets the angle unit.  The value can be DEGREE, RADIAN, or GRAD for angle units.  You can also set KEY, NOKEY, TRACE, NORMAL, CASE, NOCASE.

Returns the sin of the specified angle.  Either sin or radSin may be better translations in WebLogo depending on the state of environment variables for the angle unit.  The angle may be in degrees, radians, or gradians.
Returns the number of bytes required to store the current BASIC oprogram in external ASCII format
Stops program execution. This is similar to pausing execution in WebLogo which can't be done with a command.
Returns the sum of all elements in the specified array.  This is similar to WebLogo's sum command except that WebLogo's sum needs more than 1 numeric parameters instead of a single list or array.

Returns the tan of the specified angle.  Either tan or radTan may be better translations in WebLogo depending on the state of environment variables for the angle unit.  The angle may be in degrees, radians, or gradians.
Returns the value of the specified expression
Sets the GS display drawing boundaries
Waits for SRQ, EOI, EOF or SIZE interrupt occurs
Sets the window boundaries
